meanings.definition: To graze livestock in a pasture.
meanings.sent1: The cows pastured peacefully in the green field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer pastured his sheep in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The goats decided to have a picnic and pastured in the grassy area.
meanings.sent4: The horses pastured like kings in the vast open land.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the animals pastured contentedly under the clear sky.

meanings.definition: Used to describe animals that have been allowed to graze in a pasture.
meanings.sent1: The pastured cows looked healthy and happy.
meanings.sent2: The pastured chickens provided fresh eggs every morning.
meanings.sent3: The pastured pigs were the envy of the farm with their luxurious lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: The pastured horses had shiny coats from their outdoor adventures.
meanings.sent5: The pastured sheep had a peaceful demeanor from their time in the fields.
